intro: Iguanura remotiflora, commonly known as the red-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its dry habitat. Iguanura remotiflora is adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in environments with limited rainfall.
